Target: The Environmental Measurement Station ontology (OntoEMS) is an ontology developed for representing environmental measurement stations, reported quantities, and time series of associated readings.

Comment: A station (physical or virtual) reporting a quantity.
A prediction or estimation of a quantity.
The height reached by the water in a reservoir, river, the tide at sea, or similar.
The height reached by the water in a reservoir, river, the tide at sea, or similar.
The depth of rain that accumulated over a measurement time quantity.
The depth of rain that accumulated over a measurement time quantity.
The depth of rain that accumulated over a measurement time quantity.
The volume of water which passes a river cross section per unit time.
Temperature of the outside air that would be indicated by a thermometer exposed to the air at a location sheltered from direct solar radiation.
Temperature of the outside air that would be indicated by a thermometer exposed to the air at a location sheltered from direct solar radiation.
Temperature of the outside air that would be indicated by a thermometer exposed to the air at a location sheltered from direct solar radiation.

Temperature of the outside air as expected to be perceived by a human being, considering the actual air temperature, relative humidity and the strength of the wind at 5 feet as well as an understanding of how heat is lost from the human body during cold and windy days.
Velocity of outside air movement.
Velocity of outside air movement.
Maximum velocity of short-lived peaks in wind speed.
Maximum velocity of short-lived peaks in wind speed.
Direction from where the wind is blowing measured relative to true north (not magnetic north).
Direction from where the wind is blowing measured relative to true north (not magnetic north).
Temperature at which the air can no longer hold all of its water vapor, and water vapor starts to condense into liquid water.
Temperature at which the air can no longer hold all of its water vapor, and water vapor starts to condense into liquid water.
Temperature at which the air can no longer hold all of its water vapor, and water vapor starts to condense into liquid water.
The pressure exerted by the atmospheric column of air above the point in question (adjusted to mean sea level).
The pressure exerted by the atmospheric column of air above the point in question (adjusted to mean sea level).
The pressure exerted by the atmospheric column of air above the point in question (adjusted to mean sea level).
Relative humidity of the outside air.
Relative humidity of the outside air.
Relative humidity of the outside air.
Prevailing horizontal distance at which an object can be clearly discerned by a certified weather observer, under current weather conditions.
The strength of the sun's ultraviolet (UV) radiation expressed as index as developed by the World Health Organization.
The likelihood of occurrence of precipitation.
The likelihood of occurrence of precipitation.
The concentration of a specific air pollutant as amount of material per unit volume of air (e.g. mass concentration).
The total solar irradiance received on a horizontal surface. It is the sum of the horizontal components of direct (beam) and diffuse irradiance.
The total solar irradiance received on a horizontal surface. It is the sum of the horizontal components of direct (beam) and diffuse irradiance.
The total solar irradiance received on a horizontal surface. It is the sum of the horizontal components of direct (beam) and diffuse irradiance.
The horizontal component of direct normal solar irradiance (irradiance arriving in a direct line from the sun as measured on a surface held perpendicular to the sun).
The horizontal component of direct normal solar irradiance (irradiance arriving in a direct line from the sun as measured on a surface held perpendicular to the sun).
The horizontal component of direct normal solar irradiance (irradiance arriving in a direct line from the sun as measured on a surface held perpendicular to the sun).
The horizontal component of diffuse solar irradiance (irradiance that is scattered by the atmosphere).
The horizontal component of diffuse solar irradiance (irradiance that is scattered by the atmosphere).
The horizontal component of diffuse solar irradiance (irradiance that is scattered by the atmosphere).
A relation between an individual measure and a measure aggregate (e.g. individual air pollutant concentration and overall air quality index).
A relation between an individual measure and a sum of measures.
A relationship between a reporting entity and the quantity it reports.
A relationship between a quantity and its forecast.
A relationship between a forecast and the respective unit of measure.
A relationship between a measure or forecast and the respective time series.
A relationship between a forecast and its creation time.
Description of data source of reporting station (e.g. API URL)
Description of unique identifier of reporting station
Description of observation location (i.e. point location in WGS84)
Description of observation elevation (i.e. in metres)
